events.name: Social Coding
events.description: A space for women coders to learn from each other, to practice and discuss learnings with fellow peers. This would be a weekly event of informal space to do coding. So bring your pet projects along or join one of our existing teams/ projects to work on. Featured Projects:https://trello.com/b/kl2BTwil/wwc-sg-social-coding-projects First timers, please read:Newbies Step-by-step Guide Please bring your own laptop. Agenda:6:30p - Registration and Introduce projects7:00p - Break out into groups and Start coding! ^_^8:30p - End session There is no food provided, so please make preparations to grab a bite before you turn up. Also, we recommend to bring your own water bottle along. Psst, this event is intended for ladies only. Host:
events.location: #03-04, IDA Labs@NDC 111 Middle Road, National Design Centre, Singapore 188969., IDA Labs@NDC 111 Middle Road, National Design Centre

events.name: Polymorph Brooch or Magnet Workshop
events.description:
Learn to make your very own brooch or magnet using Polymorph, a type of mouldable thermoplastic with our very own craft enthusiast - Felicia Ow.

Click on link to find out more and Sign Up! Limited slots available!
events.location: National Design Centre, 111 Middle Road, Singapore 188969

events.name: IxD Session: A conversation with Dr Jacob Greenshpan, Google Launchpad UX Expert
events.description: This June, we have a very special guest flying in all the way from Isreal - Dr Jacob Greenshpan.   About Dr Jacob Greenshpan UX strategic design, lecturing around the world and innovation — these are what I do. I design creative user interface and am honoured to be a member of the advisory board for the Google Launchpad accelerator for startups. I have a Ph.D. in cognitive psychology and user interface design. Building innovative, top-of-the-line UX solutions and applications has been my passion for the last 20+ years. Before becoming an independent consultant, I co-founded two companies: UI Ltd. (which is the largest company in Israel for UX design) and Applied Cognitive Engineering, Ltd. (ACE) for cognitive training.  In addition to working as strategic UX consultant, I coordinate the UX activity for Google’s Launchpad program, an acceleration program for startups. I have created UX expert communities for helping startups in Berlin, Paris, Barcelona, Bangalore, Rio de Janeiro, Jakarta, Mexico City and many more places. I have had the honour of meeting over 700 startups around the world and helping them turn their dreams into reality. Agenda for the night 7pm – 7.30pm: Registration, drinks and networking (no food served, feel free to bring your own!)  7.30pm – 8.30pm: Conversation with Dr Jacob 8.30pm – 9pm: Networking and drinks :) We're hoping to keep the session really informal and casual where it is more conversational centric so bring along some of your burning questions to the session. The value of the meetup is as good as the questions asked :) Also, if you would like to ask the question privately, please email me at kiat@ixda.sg and I'll ask them on your behalf :) Alternatively, you may like to tweet us the questions to @IxDASG and we can have that answered! Venue sponsor  A very big thanks to the folks at Collision 8 for sponsoring the venue! Thanks to Bryant, Xinyi, Jen for making this happen! P.s: Apologies for the very short notice! We feel that having Dr Jacob to share would be valuable for many so we decided to organise it in an agile fashion. If you're unable to make it, we'll make sure recordings are available!
events.location: Collision 8 High Street Centre, 1 North Bridge Road #08-08, Singapore
